forumNotes.author: krackpot
forumNotes.content:
Hello everyone!  

Currently I'm looking for a bootloader:  
- which can be booted from say a USB thumbdrive  
- allows each OS on each HD to be independent and unaware of one another (Windows won't know Linux exists on another HD)  
- if I were to remove the USB thumbdrive with the bootloader, it would just load up the master HD's OS with no hitches  
- if I were to remove a HD with an OS, it wouldn't behave differently (maybe not show the option to boot that OS)  

I just want something that will keep each OS install separate without having to constantly mind the Windows bootloader taking over the Linux one or vice versa.  

Does such a bootloader exist!? Is there one with nice graphics (Like Cameleon2) ?  

Sorry if I posted this in the wrong forum.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Both grub4dos and Syslinux/isolinux/memdisk will do. (just look in the sub-forums)  

There is NOT an automatic provision to do this, anyway:  
> - if I were to remove a HD with an OS, it wouldn't behave differently (maybe not show the option to boot that OS)
you will have to remove the entry in the menu manually.  

The graphical look can be simple or complex, here are a couple example screenshots:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...o...129399\&st=5](http://www.msfn.org/board/index.php?showtopic=129399&st=5 "External link")
